text: this is kit Eaton for the New York Times
smartphones typically get blamed for
being part of the noise of modern life
but with apps like comm installed your
phone can actually help you find calm
and quiet and another wise busy day calm
which is available free for both iOS and
Android is made by the same people
behind calm calm and it's a guided
meditation app this means it contains a
number of tracks where a spoken voice
leads you through different meditation
ideas the idea is you sit down and relax
and listen for anything from a couple of
minutes up to 20 and follow the spoken
instructions to lead your mind into a
karma state this app is pleasantly free
of some of the mystic mumbo jumbo that
you might think goes with meditation and
I find it definitely helps me find calm
while a few tracks are available for
free inside the app to access the full
meditation content which includes
courses on different topics like
boosting your confidence you do have to
pay and this can cost about 10 dollars a
year a great alternative to calm is
headspace which is also free for both
iOS and Android devices this is a
similar guided meditation app that uses
spoken voice instructions and this time
the voice is a British one which may or
may not tickle your fancy the free app
contains 10 meditation courses which
you're supposed to listen to over 10
days that teach you how to find in a
calm and if you stick to your meditation
habits the app rewards you with some
extras such as little cute animations
while the core app is free though to
access the full content and other
meditation courses plus to you 13
dollars a month or 95 a year lastly
check out the app happier which is also
available free for iOS and Android it's
designed to help you find a moment of
happiness in another wise busy day by
acting as a gratitude journal a place
where you jot down notes and even
include pictures things that have made
you happy that particular day it's a fun
activity
definitely calming and the app is nicely
designed and that's it from me I hope
you enjoy relaxing with these apps
